svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - August 9 2020

title: "Week in Ethereum News
August 9, 2020" date: "2020-08-09"
Eth News and Links
Eth1
• Regenesis plan proposal
• Latest core devs call video. Beiko notes
• Turbogeth improved stability release
• Turbogeth’s staged sync explainer - how it does a full sync to an archive node in under 700gb and
just a few days
Eth2
• Latest what’s new in eth2 : the Medalla multi-client testnet launched
• Danny Ryan’s latest quick eth2 update , attacknet bounties now tripled
• Jonny Rhea’s attacks found a bug in Go-lang with the help of protolambda, Raúl Kripalani, and
Preston Van Loon (Go already released a bugfix)
• Latest eth2 call . Notes from Ben and Mamy .
• Latest Prysmatic client update
• Eth2 annotated specs from Vitalik Buterin and Ben Edgington
• Ethereum Foundation is looking to expand its security team for eth2
• Stats from crawling Medalla nodes . A serious problem: client diversity
• Some guides to staking: Larrypc , Somer Esat , CoinCashew . Make sure you collect your POAP medals
for each different client
• Defining attestation effectiveness : Attestant’s work to create the stat on validator quality that
you now see on beaconcha.in
EIPs/Standards
• ERC2771 : Secure Protocol for Native Meta Transactions
• ERC2848 : My Own Messages
Crypto
• StarkWare’s IACR paper on EthSTARK
• BLS sigs explainer series
Layer2
• iden3’s hermez zk-rollup , expected to launch with 2000 tps on mainnet this year.
• Optimize for minting tokens : a different l2 flavor inspired by Reddit bakeoff
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Trail of Bits !
DeFi composability is hard, and it’s easy to accidentally expose your new protocol to unexpected risk.
Stay current: learn about the latest composability risk Sam Sun found in yEarn , and follow Trail of
Bits' checklist for integrating with tokens .
Stuff for developers
• ZoKrates v0.6 - unsigned integer types, zokrates.js works with browser/nodeJS, native SHA256
implementation at 28k constraints
• TypeChain’s stable ethers v5 release
• Opyn got hacked for 370k USDC, and then Sam Sun helped them rescue another 570k. They reimbursed all
victims . Here’s Peckshield’s explainer . If you prefer to watch, here’s an Epheph video explainer
• Sam Sun found a bug in the initial release of yEarn’s yVault where an attacker could “man in the
middle” the swaps.
• Martinet Lee and Jun-You Liu also found some exploits in the yCurve yVault
• Gas Saver : wrap methods to use gas tokens
• Deploy your first contract with Chainlink
• Clean contracts - Solidity best practices
• eth-permit : easy token permit signing npm
• OpenZeppelin Contracts special release to support Solidity v0.7
• Trail of Bits token integration checklist
Ecosystem
• ethereum.org development update : a new look!
• Save on paying gas with a weekly plan. In other words: what time of day gas prices are low
• Related to when gas prices are low: DeFi is taking off in China
Enterprise
• A Coca-Cola bottling group to use Baseline Protocol on Eth mainnet for their supply chain vendors
• Goldman Sachs exploring creation of its own cryptodollar stablecoin
Application layer
• DarkForest goes live with Ropsten testnet beta: a decentralized, real time strategy game using
SNARKs
• Deversifi draws an unsecured credit line using Aave and OpenLaw contract
• Chem@Golem , a Seti@Home inspired scientific modelling project
• How yDai offers fully collateralized, fixed-interest borrowing using zero-coupon bonds
• Set Protocol v2 : many more assets, yield farming support, much more gas efficient
Tokens/Business/Regulation
• dYdX launches their 10x perpetual ETHUSD
• Decentralized governance: innovation or limitation ?
• Grayscale’s Ethereum Trust will be SEC reporting company due to “record quarterly inflows” and
weekly inflows over 10 million USD
• Putin allows crypto ownership but requires rubles as the medium of exchange
General
• Andreas Antonopoulos video answering basic Ethereum questions
• This week, BTC maxis spun themselves their usual tall tales about how hard it was to figure out the
exact ETH supply. It’s not that hard. Here’s Nethermind. Geth . Or this Marc-André Dumas script
• ETC 51% attacked for second time in a week
• Filecoin plans to implement EIP1559 on its next testnet
Job Listings
• mStable is looking for developers: see 3 open roles
• OpenZeppelin: Security Services Lead , Security Platform Dev & Open Source Dev
• 15+ open roles at Chainlink: Senior Software Eng , Product Marketing , Test Eng
• Trail of Bits is looking for: blockchain security engineer & senior software eng
• Celer Network: Android developer
• 0x is looking for all kinds of devs: full-stack, back-end, and front-end
Want your job listing here ? $250 per line (~75 character limit including spaces), payable in
ETH/DAI/USDC to evan.ethereum.eth. Questions? thecryptonewspodcast at-gmail
Week in Eth News available sponsor slots tokenized as $EVAN
This week, I tokenized a few available sponsorship slots for this newsletter as $EVAN. I also added a
few more redemption options. Without me doing anything it got listed on CoinGecko and CoinMarketCap,
as well as a semi-accurate CoinTelegraph article. Check it out if you’re interested in my experiment
in tokenizing indie media sponsorship space.
Permalink for this week’s issue: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-august-9-2020/
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive it weekly
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note ( new/changes in bold ) :
• Aug 9-11 - EDCON
• Aug 13 - Randomness Summit
• Aug 28-29 - Chainlink’s Smart Contract Virtual Summit
• Oct 2-30 - EthOnline hackathon
• Nov 6-7 - virtual Trufflecon
